text: Incorporate the basic principles of Rogerian psychotherapy into your management style. (1/2)
Treat others by holding them in an unconditionally positive regard, with compassion, and be congruent. (2/2)
Be sure to implement a dress code for this year’s Christmas party. Doing so, establishes a professional boundary.
If possible, sit next to an interviewer not across from them at the table/desk. The nonverbal interpretation is that sitting across from 1/2
the interviewer creates an adversarial impression. Sitting next to the interviewer creates a friendly and collaborative impression. 2/2
Don't point. Emphasize direction with an open palm. This action shows that you're open and affable, and is far more persuasive to others.
Never show anger at the office. Showing anger diminishes the connections you've built with others. Getting angry is sure to degrade rapport.
A transformative HR Dept is one which reduces risk and liability, but also generates revenue. It can be done!
Do not rest your hands over your genitalia when standing in front of a crowd. This posture is indicative of insecurity and nervousness. 1/2
Instead, place your hands behind your back. This posture indicates that you are confident, approachable, and have nothing to hide. 2/2
Anyone who preambles a statement with, "To be honest...", is generally dishonest. Honest people have no need to start a sentence as such.
Inspire people to come forward to contribute their best-self, and instill a philosophy of continuous improvement. You set the standard.
Systematically desensitizing employees to change eliminates resistance to it. Talk about why change is good and how everyone will benefit.
Avoid beige or light-colored suits. Wear grey, navy, or black. These colors signify power and professionalism, and enhance credibility.
Men with combovers are perceived to be less trustworthy than men with neatly groomed hair. Combovers indicate an unwillingness to change.
Have you analyzed your market this quarter? Forecasting is imperative to maintaining your competitive advantage. If you snooze, you lose.
Do not direct, but persuade employees to achieve goals. Everyone's favorite radio station is WII FM (What's In It For Me).
Great managers develop altruism and boost their employees' confidence. Doing so creates buy-in, thereby increasing employees' motivation.
Vision → Goal → Plan → Action → SUCCESS
As you think, so shall you be.
